trans-unit.source: 1. How will customers be notified of the retiring SDK?
trans-unit.target: 1. How will customers be notified of the retiring SDK?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will provide 12 month advance notification to the end of support of the retiring SDK in order to facilitate a smooth transition to a supported SDK.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will provide 12 month advance notification to the end of support of the retiring SDK in order to facilitate a smooth transition to a supported SDK.

trans-unit.source: Further, customers will be notified through various communication channels – Azure Management Portal, Developer Center, blog post, and direct communication to assigned service administrators.
trans-unit.target: Further, customers will be notified through various communication channels – Azure Management Portal, Developer Center, blog post, and direct communication to assigned service administrators.

trans-unit.source: 2. Can customers author applications using a "to-be" retired DocumentDB SDK during the 12 month period?
trans-unit.target: 2. Can customers author applications using a "to-be" retired DocumentDB SDK during the 12 month period?

trans-unit.source: Yes, customers will have full access to author, deploy and modify applications using the "to-be" retired DocumentDB SDK during the 12 month grace period.
trans-unit.target: Yes, customers will have full access to author, deploy and modify applications using the "to-be" retired DocumentDB SDK during the 12 month grace period.

trans-unit.source: During the 12 month grace period, customers are advised to migrate to a newer supported version of DocumentDB SDK as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: During the 12 month grace period, customers are advised to migrate to a newer supported version of DocumentDB SDK as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: 3. Can customers author and modify applications using a retired DocumentDB SDK after the 12 month notification period?
trans-unit.target: 3. Can customers author and modify applications using a retired DocumentDB SDK after the 12 month notification period?

trans-unit.source: After the 12 month notification period, the SDK will be retired.
trans-unit.target: After the 12 month notification period, the SDK will be retired.

trans-unit.source: Any access to DocumentDB by an applications using a retired SDK will not be permitted by the DocumentDB platform.
trans-unit.target: Any access to DocumentDB by an applications using a retired SDK will not be permitted by the DocumentDB platform.

trans-unit.source: Further, Microsoft will not provide customer support on the retired SDK.
trans-unit.target: Further, Microsoft will not provide customer support on the retired SDK.

trans-unit.source: 4. What happens to Customer’s running applications that are using unsupported DocumentDB SDK version?
trans-unit.target: 4. What happens to Customer’s running applications that are using unsupported DocumentDB SDK version?

trans-unit.source: Any attempts made to connect to the DocumentDB service with a retired SDK version will be rejected.
trans-unit.target: Any attempts made to connect to the DocumentDB service with a retired SDK version will be rejected.

trans-unit.source: 5. Will new features and functionality be applied to all non-retired SDKs
trans-unit.target: 5. Will new features and functionality be applied to all non-retired SDKs

trans-unit.source: New features and functionality will only be added to new versions.
trans-unit.target: New features and functionality will only be added to new versions.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an old, non-retired, version of the SDK your requests to DocumentDB will still function as previous but you will not have access to any new capabilities.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an old, non-retired, version of the SDK your requests to DocumentDB will still function as previous but you will not have access to any new capabilities.

trans-unit.source: 6. What should I do if I cannot update my application before a cut-off date
trans-unit.target: 6. What should I do if I cannot update my application before a cut-off date

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you upgrade to the latest SDK as early as possible.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you upgrade to the latest SDK as early as possible.

trans-unit.source: Once an SDK has been tagged for retirement you will have 12 months to update your application.
trans-unit.target: Once an SDK has been tagged for retirement you will have 12 months to update your application.

trans-unit.source: If, for whatever reason, you cannot complete your application update within this timeframe then please contact the [DocumentDB Team](mailto:askdocdb@microsoft.com) and request their assistance before the cutoff date.
trans-unit.target: If, for whatever reason, you cannot complete your application update within this timeframe then please contact the [DocumentDB Team](mailto:askdocdb@microsoft.com) and request their assistance before the cutoff date.
